page.title: 20VILLAGE LIFE TODAY
page.content: THE WORKING POPULATION OF THE VILLAGE ARE MAINLY{COMMUTERS. THE TWICE WEEKLY {BUS SERVICE}IS BARELY ADEQUATE FOR SHOPPERS TO ALTRINCHAM.THE VILLAGE SHOP CUM POST OFFICE ALSO SELLS WINE AS THERE IS{NO PUB;}IT IS ALSO A MEETING PLACE AS THE VILLAGE HALL BELONGS TO THE GIRL GUIDES. A {MOBILE {LIBRARY}CALLS ONCE A FORTNIGHT. A PRIVATE SCHOOL WILL CLOSE AT THE END OF 1985; THE VILLAGE CHILDREN ALREADY COMMUTE TO ASHLEY,THREE MILES AWAY.AN ARTIST SELLS HIS ANIMAL AND LANDSCAPE PICTURES FROM HIS HOME.THE VICAR IS ALSO RURAL DEAN. A VILLAGER WHOSE PARENTS WORKED ON THE ESTATE LIVES IN IVY COTTAGE WHICH{ STILL HAS A{COAL FIRE RANGE}ON WHICH SHE SOMETIMES COOKS WHEN THE OVERHEAD POWER LINES FAIL IN THE WINTER.THERE IS NO STREET LIGHTING OR GAS MAINS.A {DISTRICT NURSE}IS AN ASSET.
